abstract: The European Commission’s antitrust unit on Monday published a torrent of documents to back up its contention that the record $1.5 billion fine it imposed in May against Intel was justified.
snippet: The European Commission’s antitrust unit on Monday published a torrent of documents to back up its contention that the record $1.5 billion fine it imposed in May against Intel was justified.
lead_paragraph: The Dell executive was sweating bullets at the prospect that chips from Advanced Micro Devices would be used in Dell personal computers instead of chips from Intel, Dell’s main supplier.

headline.main: European Union Lays Out Its Evidence Against Intel
